subject: Business
title: The Pain of Paying
description: A 60-second lesson on The Pain of Paying.

hook.text: Paying cash for a $100 dinner hurts more than swiping a card for $100. The money is the same. The pain isn't.

buildup.text: The pain of paying is a real neurological response. Paying activates the brain's pain centers.

discovery.text: Credit cards, subscriptions, and pre-payments all reduce pain by separating the moment of payment from consumption.

twist.text: All-inclusive resorts exploit this perfectly: pay once, then everything feels free for a week.

climax.text: Uber removed the wallet moment entirely. The ride ends, you walk out. No cash, no card, no pain.

punchline.text: Make paying invisible. The purchase becomes painless.

quiz.question: Why does paying with a credit card hurt less than paying with cash?
options: It separates the moment of payment from consumption
Credit card purchases are always cheaper
Cash is heavier and harder to carry
